Authors:
Peimin He, Binghua Jiao, Chuner Cai, Lingke Wang, Lingjie
Zhou
Title:
Complete chloroplast genome of green tide algae Ulva flexuosa
(Ulvophyceae, Chlorophyta) with comparative analysis
Abstract:
Ulva flexuosa is one kind of green tide algae outbreak in
the Yellow Sea of China in the past ten years. They are nutrient-rich
biomass resources for commercial production if handled in time. In the
present study, we sequenced the chloroplast genome of U. flexuosa
followed by annotation and comparative analysis. It was indicated that
genomes have highly conservation among Ulva spp., and highly
rearrangement outside them. Though U. flexuosa is more closely to U.
linza than U. fasciata in phylogenetic tree, the average Ka/Ks between
U. flexuosa and U. linza assessed by 67 protein-coding genes was higher
than those between U. flexuosa and other species in Ulva spp., due to
the variation of psbZ, psbM and ycf20. Our results have laid the
foundation for future studies on the evolution of chloroplast genomes of
Ulva, as well as the molecular identification of U. flexuosa
varieties.
